name: LORENE WASHINGTON
text: I was in Florida when I received a call from my neighbor stating that my kitchen was wet and the laundry room looked like a bomb had gone off. The water went into my pantry, under the wood to the great room, and into the dining room. It was mess. I called Paul Davis from Florida and requested they start restoration immediately. Two days later i got home and I could not believe my eyes. There were two large storage pods in the driveway, all the furniture was removed and stored. All the cabinets and cupboards were removed, the place was completely stripped. There were big fans all over, and the rooms were blocked off from the rest of the house. Once dry, they came in with contractors and started to restore my home. The job when finished was outstanding. I love my new kitchen,  and flooring in the great room and dining room. the site manager was outstanding, he checked with me every day to make sure I was satisfied. The workers were extremely friendly, and experienced. I would recommend Paul Davis Restoration to anyone needing this kind of help. Dwight Washington

name: T S
text: DENNIS MAYNOR and the remediation crew were great on both of my claims. professional and quick with the work. I wish he would have been the project manager on my rebuild. However on the rebuild side.. not so much.. said project manager who I will not mention he knows who he is did not communicate well with the contractors on my rebuild. I had to fix AC vents myself that said project manager had told contractors to fix as I told them not to take down. they taped around them and when they took tape off. they ripped em out... they had no knowledge of it to fix them and were not told.. They damaged my drawer in my kitchen and tried to blame me for it. Broke my kitchen faucet as they should have taken the faucet from the sink.. Instead I find my sink on the floor all willy nilly . On the paint process they puled nails and picture hooks and patched but on other areas they just painted over the pic hooks and so forth. They also painted without using drop cloths on my wood floors and set a paint tray on my wood floor without a drop cloth under it. and I will have to pay someone to pressure wash my front sidewalk as they got paint spatters everywhere when they were cutting and working outside.. They did fix the items in question, drawer faucet and cabinets. but project manager said we will go thru this during the walk thru.. To me it would make sense to take care of this BEFORE THE walk thru.. I am visually impaired and I am glad I had friends to point out stuff they needed to fix.. They got it all fixed but it should have never come to that had the project manager been on the ball. Y'all need to put me on the payroll for this job. and he charged me for a Dump truck that did not get used for hauling away debris.. This was a rebuild no debris to haul away. He got snappy and angry.. "I am not taking that truck charge off"  and took it personally when I questioned the Dump truck charge. I am not trying to nickel and dime anyone I just expect things to be as they were before it happened. Said project manager was very aloof and uncaring or understanding. I might be legally blind but I am not stupid. If I was totally blind with no help my place would have been totally jacked up after the sign off. and lastly they put my upper kitchen cabinets in crooked.They had to pull and put in correctly... who does not use a level when putting in cabinets. Very hasty sloppy work that should have been done right the first time.  I understand that folks try to get over on folks like y'all but I just wanted stuff done right.. It was a very painful process Tim Seh

name: Kent Schroeder
text:
We had a problem with mold forming along out dining room baseboards. Paul Davis Restoration was recommended to remove the moldy materials and repair the walls. Two groups of folks with different skills and equipment were needed to effect the repair.

Phase 1: Dan Wong came to the house and took pictures and measurements and provided a detailed estimate for removing the mold. Work was scheduled soon after and workers removed the affected materials within a couple of hours and left a very large dehumidifier, four or five air handlers and a couple of HEPA filter units. After three days of continuous noise and tripped circuit breakers the walls were dried out, my allergies started clearing up and I was a happy camper.

Phase 2: Dustin Hunt came to the house to survey the "damage" take measurements and pictures, then provided a detailed estimate for reconstruction of the dining room walls. Work was scheduled soon after and workers arrived at the scheduled time and completed the work over 2.5 days since drywall and paint take longer. Now our dining room is as good as new and most important of all the wife is happy.

resp.text: Hi Kent - Thank you so much for your feedback! We are so glad to hear that you are fully satisfied with our work. Please don't hesitate to reach out should you ever need anything from us.

name: Tommie Hardy
text: My experience with this company is good and bad. The crewmen are polite and helpful and they did very nice work on repairs, painting and carpentry work on my house. The owner of the company sometimes doesn’t take the time to call me as his customer and discuss the repairs and my concerns of how I want my house remodeled. The owners will not at times call or email back days or weeks sometimes. I had to wait almost two years before my house was completed. The roofers stole my circular saw and it wasn’t returned to me and I think the owners need to practice in better professional behavior towards future customers. I can’t at this time recommend this company to my colleagues, friends and family.

name: Tony Smyly
text:
David, Mike, Jose, Kevin, Ryan an all others that worked at our house were very professional. Mobile Marble removed all of our 1979 year bathrooms and transformed them both into 2021 Marble masterpieces. New flooring, custom vanities, walkin marble shower to replace a rusted out tub, marble tub, custom over the toilet cabinets to match vanities, all new faucets, marble tops with marble sinks on the new vanities, new toilets and all new valves to turn on and off the water. They transformed both bathrooms into a very beautiful part of our home.  I highly recommend anyone wanting to remodel your bathrooms to call Mobile  Marble first.

Thank you Mobile Marble

Tony and Lila

resp.text:
Thanks Tony & Lila, all of us here enjoyed working to transform your bathrooms, ya'll are awesome
David Lindsey

name: Mike Cutler
text:
We have been wanting to update both our bathrooms (master and guest) for a couple years.  After talking with three companies, Mobile Marble was clearly our choice.  David and Mike listened fully as we explained what we wanted and answered all our questions, both at the show room and our house.  Mike came to our house at least twice to take pictures and measurements of our bathrooms and once we agreed on the project he called me several times to update me.

When the date arrived to start the project, Ryan and Thad were on time, efficiently set up, put down tarps to protect floors and went right to work demoing the guest bath (basic grade shower unit).  The next day the new shower was installed.  The following Monday, Ryan and Thad demoed the master bath (basic grade shower and a garden tub).  On Tuesday they installed the marble for the new shower and covered it while another contractor built a new linen closet.  When the contractor was done, David, Ryan and Thad installed the heavy duty glass and sliding door system to complete the new master shower.

This was by no means the biggest project the Mobile Marble group has done.  But my wife and I are completely thrilled with their work.  David, Mike, Ryan and Thad were a joy to interact with, explained their process and progress each day, were as tidy as possible and let us know when each phase of the project would be complete and the showers usable.

I told Mike from the start "I will talk about you (Mobile Marble) based on the job that you do.  Do well and I will say good things.  If not, my comments will be negative."  Mike's response was "Fair enough."  With both phases of the project complete, we are extremely happy with the results.  And just as important, everyone we met through Mobile Marble was professional, considerate of our home, and the quality of their work was top notch.

We would not hesitate to use Mobile Marble again or to recommend to others.

name: Eddie Rogers
text: Great people.

name: Elizabeth Donald
text: I am VERY pleased with the quality of our marble shower and vanity countertops that Mobile Marble created for our master bathroom. Everyone was very professional and installed our marble on TIME!  They are one of the few businesses that actually showed up when they said they would!

text: The shower for my mother is perfect.  completely professional.

text: I had a cracked cultured marble shower pan and a leaking faucet on my tub. David and his crew with Ryan and Thad did an amazing job in 2.5 days of replacing my entire marble shower, tub and vanity with new updated marble of almost the same color, a frameless glass door to replace the existing plexi door and and all new faucets on the tub and vanity. Outstanding work, great service and best of all they stand behind their work. Highly recommend Mobile Marble.

text: Mobile Marble Company redid my vanity in my bathroom and it turned out stunning! If you can envision it, they can make it happen. Super helpful staff and always willing to answer any questions you might have. I would highly recommend Mobile Marble if you are looking to remodel your bathroom.

name: Jessica Svenson
text: The experience with this company after the storm has been hands down the best around. Many contractors are gouging labor pricing because they have more work than they know what to do with. Handy Men has maintained  their labor cost but like any business materials are sky rocketing. It is refreshing to have a contractor show up and do what they say they will do and make things right when there is an issue. Do yourself a favor and call the local guy!

name: Mark Thimsen
text: Dave is very, very responsive.  We recently had a failing smoke alarm that was going off in our beach rental condo and we had guests there.  It was a Sunday morning and we live 6 hours away so we really needed to get someone quickly over there to take care of the situation.  Dave called me right back and then headed straight to the unit and installed four new smoke detectors for us, per our request.  He did a professional job, used larger cover plates where needed to avoid needing touch up paint, was pleasant to work with, kept us informed, made our guest happy, charged a very fair price and didn't mark up his materials.  Couldn't be happier!  Dave is our new go-to guy.

name: David Lloyd
text:
I am a long time customer of David Stewart and his crew doing business as The Handymen LLC in Foley.  This time I used David and his company for Hurricane Sally repairs.  I was fortunate that I had minor damage to my home.  However, the fact that my damage was not major caused some of the contractors I spoke to to put me off or quote me exorbitant prices to do the work.

The Handymen came out and did roof work one weekend and then David personally came by on a Sunday afternoon and repaired a window for me.  David told me how the job was going to be done and the materials required.  Again, not a huge project but one that required skill, knowledge, and the correct tools.  Of course it turned out well.

I have used this company on two other occasions for exterior work on my townhome.  I know they are licensed in Gulf Shores and have done many projects here.  I have not had to call them out to “repair” their repairs like some of the others that I have used previously.  I have no reservations in recommending The Handymen LLC of Foley to others seeking home repairs.

name: Marion Richardson
text: When our central unit quit Dave was there within the hour to check for the problem and had it cleaned and running again shortly after. Professional, honest and reliable

I’m sorry we did not get in touch with you. We have been very busy trying to get our clients fixed up from the hurricane sally. We would like the opportunity to make it up to you.

I looked back & found no record of you calling?

name: Rachel Holley
text: I originally called Handymen, LLC to remove the carpet in my garden room and to replace it with bamboo tile...Two days before the project began, I cut the carpet and discovered old painted hardwood boards in perfect condition...I sent pictures to David Stewart, the General Contractor, and he didn't mind quickly changing plans so that we could preserve the beauty of these 74 year old floors...The before and after pictures are below...Simply amazing...David Stewart made my dreams come true...His ideas are unique and he tailors everything according to your requests...All work was impeccably done...And David had the proper permits from the City of Mobile...If you have any dreams of what you may want done, David Stewart will make it happen...And all of his work is done to code...He will keep you apprised all along the way as to true expectations in remodeling or repair and pricing...There were no surprises with invoicing...Handymen, LLC will be doing all of my future projects...They are very trustworthy and they clean up after the job is done...The Highest Quality Work I Have Ever Seen...

name: Bob Follis
text:
When your wife wakes you up at 2:00 in the morning and asks you if you hear water running, you know immediately it's not going to be fun. That's exactly what happened early this morning and the leak in the basement was in fact "not fun".
I turned the water off and first thing this morning called B & C. The lady who answered the phone was super nice. She set up an appointment and told me what time the plumber should arrive. Sure enough about 30 minutes prior to arrival the plumber gave me a ring to let me know what time he'd be here and he showed up right on schedule as promised.
He was very professional and we couldn't have been any happier with the work he did. We highly recommend B&C and I assure you we will use them again when we have plumbing needs.

name: Keith Collins
text: Quick service, very costly  $165.00 to replace 3/4 coupling and 3/4 male treaded coupling. I  had already dug whole and told them what to bring charged me $30 material $135 labor! I'm in the wrong business!

name: Ams has Happy
text: This company employs prompt and professional people. They handled my problem with an underground leak in no time and told me exactly how much it would be beforehand. 30 day guarantee of their work... couldn't have asked for better service. Thank you, B&C (Especially Holly and Craig!)

name: David Solomon
text:
For this review, I feel I must first present a little information up front.
For the last several months I have been having issues with the plumbing in my house.  My house was built in 2007 with PVC pipe throughout.  Let’s just first say that after purchasing the home I later believed the plumbing was not installed to code, and first experienced several water leaks of which I fixed myself.

Several months ago I hired a plumber to come in and resolve a hot water (lack of) issue.  The Hot water tank had made an awful screeching noise similar to what I have been hearing in my modern GE Refrigerator with a water filter. At the time the plumber removed a check valve on the water Heater which resolved my Hot water problem and the screeching noise.  No further investigation was conducted on why the Hot water heater started having issues and I believe that repair cost me around $100.00.
So in the last couple of months I have still have that screeching with my Refrigerator and the pipes had been banging whenever we flushed one of the toilets.  Upon doing some research to try and resolve the banging pipe issues I had come across an article on a thermal expansion tank upstream from the Hot Water Heater on the Cold water line.  I located mine under the house just as the main cold water line comes in the house. The tank has a valve in it and is supposed to give a cushion for the water when it expands.  I went to check the expansion tank and when I put on an air tester, water came out, which is an indication of a faulty tank.  I purchased a new one and left the air pressure at the manufacture default and installed it.  Now my pipes started banging worse and the tank started making a sucking sound. I further researched the issue and found an article that too much water pressure can wreak havoc on your water system so I went to Lowe’s and picked up a cheap home water pressure gauge. I tested my system and found that my home was averaging around 130PSI. Based on this information resources indicated that a faulty Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) just up from the home water meter could be the culprit. I located mine by digging about a foot up from the local water meter and left it uncovered.
It was finally time for me to call a plumber as I am not one, and only completed the previous steps out of necessity.  I am a retired Enlisted Veteran and have not had a real job for six years and have been struggling to pay my bills.

The day before Christmas I called B & C Plumbing Inc. and left message on their phone system that I would be needing their services when they could work me in.  Tuesday after Christmas I received a courteous phone call from the B& C customer service and scheduled a Master Plumber to arrive at my home between 14:00 – 16:00. Shortly after that Drew the Master Plumber called me from his cell phone and said he was on his way over because he had a cancellation and would come and resolve the issue.

This is where the negative experience starts.  Drew arrived at my front door knowing the information that I had already shared previously and I shared that information with him again on what my issue was going on under the house.  His first statement to me before looking at anything was that it was going to cost me $300.00. No indication of a discount for anything or because I was a Military Vet.  Now first off, I expected that he would be crawling under my home and fix some of the issues with the bagging pipes (Non-Code meeting).  He had no time to give me a run down on what the problem was nor what it the cost layout was to fix my issues.

He proceeded to place a water pressure gauge on the outside faucet and recorded that the PSI was 145. He then went to the Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) and replaced it spending less than two hours of actual time far less work as much of the time was him on the Cell phone.

resp.text: Mr. Solomon, in response to your review I would like to apologize for your unsatisfactory experience with our company.  I would also like to state that we did not install the plumbing originally in your home in 2007.  We thank you for your comment about our courteous service manager calling and setting up your appointment.  We always offer an estimate for the cost of the repairs before any work is conducted, which you approved and paid for the work performed.   We do offer military, senior citizen, and all local law enforcement discounts, if we are informed ahead of time we can most certainly add that discount to your invoice.

name: Phyllis Cox
text: They are honest and reliable.

name: Krissi Harpel
text: All the reviews were great so I was excited to get started with this company.  Their representative came to the house and brought a contractor, I was told it would take about a week to generate an estimate of materials.  During that week I sent some colors I liked and a couple of questions and I was not getting any response from the designer .  Once the week was up I sent an email to the designer and told her I needed someone who was going to be responsive to emails .  She immediately responded saying that she could not get my cabinets to meet our timeline and I would have to find someone else ...which if she had paid attention I had asked for an estimate on painting and replacing .  I then left a message for someone from management. to call me and got no response.  Very very disappointing

resp.text: I spoke with Krissi and explained a few items to her concerning her project and attempted to assist her with her project even though Coastal is not performing the project.  Hopefully this will help.  We do not paint cabinets and recommend under normal conditions that this not be done.  Typically, a paint job will have to repeated in the near term due to underlying issues with cabinets themselves.

name: Jammie Eldridge
text: This business is a great one especially making ur home look beautiful & it has homes u can buy or rent. The owner is a really good person he also makes sure it's exactly the way u want it

name: Michael Daniel
text:
8 years ago we hired Pickett Construction to install a new roof, gutters and downspouts, and vinyl siding on our home. The quality of workmanship was outstanding, and the work was completed in  only 5 days. My wife and I could not have been happier.

Then last month after a rain shower, we noticed water stains on the ceiling in two different rooms. Because Pickett installed the roof 8 years ago, we called them about the problem. Josh sent his roofer to our home to see if a cause for the water leak(s) could be found, because from the outside the roofing shingles were not damaged or missing and looked fine. However after a few minutes looking in the attic and walking the roof, it was determined that during construction of my home some 25 years ago, a handful of framing nails used to secure the plywood roof deck had missed the rafter below, and after all these years had begun to back out of the plywood deck, pushing up the roof shingle just enough to let water pass underneath. The roofer walked the entire roof looking for nails that were backing out (not just in the area of the water stains below, but the whole roof), removing all that he found, sealing the hole and making sure the roof shingle lay flat. Two days after the repairs we had a lot of rain, and no water leaks inside the house.

Once again, Pickett Construction has made my wife and I very happy, and I will not hesitate to call them in the future. It's nice to know that the quality of workmanship and professionalism we knew 8 years ago is still present today.

name: tb harvey
text: Hired these people to do light repairs and painting.  Took 3 weeks to complete the painting.  They did poor preparation work on several parts of the house.  They did not paint the rear door to my detached garage,though they painted the trim.  They bent the gutter on my garage and was balking at replacing it until I showed some video.  They did not remount one of my porch lights, nor did they reattach a lens to one of the driveway flood lights. They left trash in the yard and on the front porch and in the plants behind the house. They missed painting trim on one of the back doors.  They replaced a French door that was alarmed. They had to detach the alarm panel from the wall because the new door trim was slightly larger.  After they finished the alarm would not work nor did they remount the alarm panel...just left it hanging by the wires.  When I questioned them the reply was “we don’t do that kind of work.”  Overall the work was substandard and the post work cleanup nearly nonexistent. Cannot recommend these folks . I have pictures if you need to see.

resp.text: We are sorry you had a bad experience.  We don't ask for final balance until you are completely satisfied. Thanks for your input.

name: Linda Ackley
text: Over the years Pickett Construction has re-roofed our home, installed new windows, and re-modeled our bathroom vanity, and kitchen.  We were pleased with all the results.  That is not to say that everything always went smoothly or on time, but that seems to be the norm for the construction business in general.  However, as promised by the Better Business Bureau of which Pickett is a member, they will resolve any problems to the customer's satisfaction and did.  Pickett also re-roofed our daughter's house to her satisfaction.

name: Amelia Cothran
text: I hired Pickett Construction to replace all of the floors in my house. The workers did an excellent job. Everyone was prompt and professional, from Josh in the office to the guys who installed the tile.I appreciated the courtesy with which the workers treated me and my children. I would definitely use Pickett Construction again.

name: Peaches H
text:
Pickett Construction replaced my roof and gutters a few years ago. They did such a good job that I called them when I was ready to replace the siding on my house. It turned out beautifully!
Alas, it had barely been done 4 months when another company dropped a ladder against it hard enough to seriously damage it. That company denied culpability. Nice,huh? I contacted Josh Pickett and he made a few calls and found that they had some siding in my style and color already in stock so I wouldn't have to shell out $300 for another box of siding. He then called his installers to see how much they would charge to swap out the few pieces of damaged siding. Mind you, this is four days before Christmas. Then I got an email saying it had all been fixed and when I asked how much my final bill was I was told "no charge"! Now that is the kind of company I will keep calling when I need repairs done. They bend over backwards to make sure they do the job right and that their customers are happy long term. I am looking forward to my next home improvement project with Pickett Construction.

name: Derek Smith
text: Very Reputable, considerate and helpful.  Quality workmanship.  My roof was done in really cold weather and they finished it in record time but they took care of all the problems that was damaged by hail damage.  I would highly recommend this Construction firm for all your Restoration or building needs.  Top Notched.

name: Tami Pickett
text: Professional services for home remodel or new custom built homes.  Customer service is always on point... Licensed, insured and bonded!  They will work with you to make your vision become a reality!

name: Bud Pommer
text:
I've had three experiences with Pickett Construction. All of them great. First; in the process of selling my home an inspection revealed hail damage on the roof and the determination that the tiles had to be replaced. Called Pickett. They gave an estimate (which ended up being lower than insurance company was going to pay). I signed contract and they showed up when they said they would, completed the work when they said they would, job looked great, did a good job cleaning up and all this done in a respectful and empathetic fashion to meet my need of completion of job prior to closing date on house.
I've moved to the Gulf Coast but still have rental property in Jefferson County.  Insurance company review dictated the need of handrails for front steps. I had one month to get then installed or they would drop my coverage on the house. The Rental Management Company for that property got some quotes but I called Pickett Construction on my own. I gave them the contract knowing I would get quality work done on time. What I really gave them besides the contract was my trust. That's something that's hard to do these days. Again, they didn't let me down!
My third experience with them was to get a quote on electrical work at that rental property. They looked at the job, told me what needed to be done but couldn't do it do it because they were covered up at the time. So, they referred me to an electrician who was half the price of other quotes and also did a great job.
I highly recommend Pickett Construction.

name: Roberts 2839
text: I had a water leak upstairs that ruined the ceiling in my living room. They repaired it quickly and professionally. Great service and friendly workers.

name: Greg Clyburn
text: I had the outside of my home repaired/updated by Pickett in 2013.  Ricky came out to give me a bid on the work and suggested some items that I had not considered.  Ricky took into account not only the house but the grounds, including sidewalk and driveway.  I agreed to these suggestions and could not be happier with the work.  I now come home (2014) to an updated home (outside) each day thanks to Ricky's suggestions.  The work was done in a timely, professional manner.  I will contact Pickett for my next home repair/update need.

name: Callie Dan
text: This contractor is outstanding! Dependable, on time, quality caftsmamship, accessible, on budget... I would recommend them to anyone.. Hope they never move away from alabaster!

name: David Roberts
text: I have used them for two jobs around my house.  They started work at the scheduled time and made sure that I was satisfied with the work done.

name: Brian Pavlick
text: Our house had some water damage leak down the walls and cause damage to the interior/exterior walls and damaged the hardwood floors as well.  Ricky came first and within 10 minutes had not only an initial diagnosis but a wonderful recommendation as far as procedure to take care of the job.  Since our first call with Pickett, we were completely satisfied.  Nevermind that they did a wonderful job and that they completed their work in the timeframe they said, I was more impressed with the individuals who respected our home and my wife staying at home by herself with a 2 month old baby.  We never once felt uneasy with the staff and always felt like we were simply letting family go in and out as they needed.  I would recommend Pickett to anyone in need of home repair and we will definitely use them again for our next projects!

name: Vandy Lowery
text: Put in wood flooring. Excellent job.  Looking at painting.

name: Lynn Sampson
text: After two decades of wind and rain, our Alabaster home's roof needed a re-boot.  I've driven by Pickett Construction's office nearly every day for the past couple of years, so I figured, "They aren't going anywhere!"  We contacted them, got an estimate, and within a week we had a brand new roof.  It looks great; the price was fair; and our insurance company was pleased to work with Pickett.  They knew Mr. Pickett by reputation!  Oh, I can't forget how thorough the actual roofing crew was when it came to cleaning up. The only thing different after they left was our beautiful new roof. I can't wait till we have the funds to set Picket Construction loose on our siding and deck and bathrooms....well, you get the picture! I trust them to do the job right whatever it is.

name: Kurt DeAngelis
text:
We decided to do a major renovation on our 30 year old split foyer in Alabaster. I had a huge wish list that far exceeded the funds I had available and had to prioritize needs, essentilas and desirables. Josh assisted me in mximizing the budget with a detailed proposal that enabled me to do this. Josh did a great job with my wife letting her see and select the tile, flooring and paint, etc.

Do you want to know if Pickett is versatile or can get the job done fast? Pickett did the following items in 17 days ... 350 feet of new privacy fence and gates, paint entire house exterior, re-roof covered deck, remove turbines and patch roof areas, repair rotted roof decking around chimney stack, re-flashed and re-roofed the area, installed new LED motion detecting security lights, installed new outdoor lighting over front door,replaced all windows with new double hung, double pane vinyl windows, installed new laminate/engineered word floors on the entire main level of the house, laid tile in both foyers, kitchen and den/study, replaced every interior door and all hardware, installed new ceiling fans in each bedroom and main foyer, removed wrought iron raining in foyer and replaced with wood and balusters, primed and painted all interior trim, scraped popcorn/acoustic ceiling from kitchen, repaired drywall issues in bedrooms and kitchen, textured and painted kitchen walls.

Any "extra" I asked about was repsonded with a written proposal so that there could be no confusion or disaggrement.

To get these things done in the time frame of 17 days ... including holidays ... shows excellent planning and execution. I was kept informed as to what was scheduled for the day, who would be there and what to expect. They arranged for the construction dumpster delivery and pick up. Pickett did a nice job on the site clean up as well.

Punch list items were few and far between and resolved promptly.

The only thing that would be close to a concern or a negative was the sub-contracting tile guy who was going through a diviorce while he did the job. He did not do a bad job but his distraction resulted in a couple of small punch list things that Josh had Tripp take care of. I was assured that they would not be using this tile guy in the future.

Would I recommend Pickett Construction to you? Absolutely. Want to see pics of the renovation? I have them. Will I use them again in the future? Absolutely. As a matter of fact, my daughter used them on a foreclosure she purchased in Calera. She got prompt thorough quality work done as well.

name: Tim Calhoun
text:
Pricing:
We contracted with Pickett to complete some work on our house to prepare it for sale. We were looking for some typical wood rot to be replaced and exterior paint. We also requested an interior paint quote. I think the quote was a bit high for the exterior work, but not so bad that I didn't go with their services. The quote for the interior painting was outrageous, so we opted for another painter. The other painter's quote was nearly $3000 less than the quote from Pickett. We were also having some plywood put in the ceiling of the carport, because the builder used interior drywall in our neighborhood. Pickett gave us a "complimentary upgrade" to beadboard instead of plain plywood. This really added a nice touch to the carport ceiling, and was an appreciated upgrade. They only requested 1/2-down to start the work, which we felt was certainly reasonable. They also honored their coupon they regularly have (often in the Alabaster Newsletter, or ValPack). We printed ours from the ValPack website.

Workmanship:
The quality of the exterior work was pretty good. There were a few spots where the painting got a bit "sloppy," but was overall good work. The beadboard in the carport made a great upgrade to our carport, and added a touch of "class" to an otherwise mundane area of the house. Unfortunately, due to our unusually cold winter, the holidays, and several bouts with rain, our work was regularly delayed. It took a bit longer than expected to complete, but didn't delay our schedule of listing the house. The little interaction I had with the crew was polite and courteous, though at times the project manager came across as mildly arrogant. Communicating with the PM via email was the best medium, although he sometimes took a bit longer than expected to return messages.

Post Work Follow-up:
Again, the delays in returning messages made for a challenge in clearing our post-work "punch list," but this was also around the holidays, so we conceded a bit.  Had there been more clear communication about workday expectations (e.g. workers will/will not be onsite today) this would have made for better overall feeling about the length of the job.
During our home buyer's inspection, they found more wood rot that was inadvertently overlooked by the crew. While I don't expect the painters to look over every square inch of the house (heck, neither did I!), it ended up being a significant portion of the chimney that had rotted out the edge of our masonite siding. One would expect that at least part of that might have been discovered and either repaired or at least alerted me to the potential change in an estimate so it could be repaired. When we approached our PM about correcting it, he gave us a price quote. After paying over $6000 for the original work, this was certainly unexpected, especially with their "1 year warranty." I spoke with Josh, the owner's son who is also in management with the company. He immediately started working with me to find a reasonable solution. I ended up having to pay a bit more, but we did come to an acceptable compromise on the final cost of the supplemental work. In the end, Josh personally stopped by the house to deliver the revised agreement and took pictures of the missed work. It turned out that the rot was more severe than even he expected. He opted to continue to honor that revised estimate and didn't charge anymore. Josh really worked hard to make a relatively displeasing situation wok out well in the end. Josh was absolutely committed to service and ensuring my end satisfaction. He even reached out after the supplemental work was completed to check in on my satisfaction, and knowing there was a bit of a sour taste, still wanted this Google Review. Josh knows what it takes to listen to customer concerns and immediately find a reasonable solution that works in the best interest of all parties. Had it not been for Josh's actions, my 4-star rating would have been a high 2-star, or low 3-star.

text: Excellent experience with Lisenby Construction.  Great work at a reasonable price.  Kept us informed throughout the entire process of remodeling a bathroom and painting 3 additional rooms.  Would definitely recommend this company.

resp.text: Thank you sir! We hope to be of service in the future.

name: Rick Harris
text:
Lisenby Construction just finished a three-week remodel of our kitchen and living room, and we could not be more pleased.  The project involved demo of some existing kitchen cabinets, replacement of a cook top and stove with a range, replacement of a vent hood, installing new kitchen lighting, laying tile, painting cabinets and bookshelves, painting trim, and painting walls.  All of this was handled by David's crew without having to sub out any work. The quality of the work done was really top-tier.  We used David's decorating consultant, Lindy, to help pick out colors, and the result has significantly brightened and beautified the two rooms where we spend most of our waking hours.

When you undertake a project that takes this much time, you quickly realize that you have invited some strangers into your home for a lengthy stay.   Well, the guys David sent did not stay strangers for very long.  They were cheerful, friendly, and helpful to us.  They added, without cost, some features to the project at our request, even though these features were not in the original contract-- for example, installing a dimmer switch in the kitchen, replacing flood lights in our dinette area so they would match the color put out by our new kitchen lighting, cutting out the trim along one wall of our living room so our bookcase could lay flat against the wall, and installing wall outlets in our bookcase.  They cleaned up after themselves every day and hauled away their own trash.  When they moved furniture around to do some painting, they always put it back where it had been.  It got to where we enjoyed having the company at our house.  At the end of the job, we were glad it was completed, but we were sorry to see the guys leave.

All the work was done with great attention to detail.  They found and installed tile to match our existing kitchen backsplash tile.  They worked on our project every weekday for three weeks.  On some days, they worked on our cabinet doors and bookcase at their shop, but on the days when they did not come, David always called us to let us know they would not be there and what they would be doing that day.

We will certainly call on Lisenby Construction if we undertake new remodeling projects.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Rick for your kind words and for trusting us with your home remodeling needs!

text: This was our first remodel, and it could not have gone smoother! The team was easy to talk to, and they were easy to reach when we had questions. They kept us up-to-date on expectations and the timing of everything. The remodel took 4 days (from demo to completion). The team arrived early each day, and they even worked holidays. They cleaned up daily (vacuumed and cleaned stainless steel appliances). We were also impressed when working with a company they contracted with. While the other company was doing their part, the Lisenby team was present, and they made sure the job was done right/well. In fact, at one point, the Lisenby team told the other team to fix something before leaving. Overall, we were highly impressed, and we intend to work with Lisenby again in the near future when we do additional remodeling!

name: Susan Goodson
text: We met this company at a home show in Huntsville.  At that time, we were in the process of selling our home and from the feedback we received, folks were wanting lighter cabinets which is why we spoke to them.   Fast forward a few months.  I rec'd a call from the company following up from our contact.  I scheduled an appt. but told the caller we have since moved but the home we own now was in need of a kitchen re-model.  The appt. came and went and no one showed.  Come to find out, rep went to our old address ( I gave new address during the phone call)  I called them to reschedule.  Rep showed up at our home and that was the end of the beginning.  He did not listen to us.  We did no want re-facing but he continued to measure existing cabinets which we did no intend to keep.  I asked to look at the books he brought in.  He asked rather snarkily, have you checked out our website???  Yes, but since you have books can I look?  At the  end of a very awkward meeting, he said they have a designer that could help with what we want.  We have not heard anything from this company 4 months later.  The end.  Would not recommend this company.

text: Goodness gracious...

name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

name: Matt Curtis
text: As an owner of a Woodland Home, Shayne Templet was very helpful in getting us information on our home to help us with a remodel. Thanks Shayne!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dominic Simard
text: They built us our dream home!  Love the home, love the people, and love the company! Our 4,650 sqft home is quality.  No major issues.  True luxury home!  Lived in the home for over a year now.

resp.text: Dominic, thank you for letting us know! We are honored to have built your dream home. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Cathy Olive
text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

name: Brandon Harwell
text: i bought my house from the 1st owner so I don't have all the building materials.  I am building a detached garage.  I am trying to match the exterior of my house (brick, shingles, etc).  Trying to get in touch with them for that is impossible.  I called a few years ago to get paint colors so I know they keep records.  Calling now is pretty much a waste of time.  They have a different girl doing it now.  Her voicemail states that it could take up to 24 hours to return call and that email would be quicker.  When I called for brick type it took 3 weeks and I sent an email.  THREE WEEKS!  My fault for forgetting to get shingle type, but now my contractor is ready to shingle my garage.  It has been 24 hours since I left a voicemail.  I have sent 3 emails and left 2 voice mails.

name: Brandi Burns
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! After your one year warranty do not expect them to help out. After being in our house for 2 1/2 years my floors are pulling apart (all of the down stairs I can put quarters between the cracks), I have a leak around my chimney(all the silicone is cracked), our HOA is now going to be responsible for a 400K loan which was used to build a pool and clubhouse (sold as part of the amenity package), the back half of the neighborhood is now front entry garage all because Woodland can and will do these things to make a buck and does not care once you have purchased the house.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

As for the floors the only response I get is Wolde put those in and from Wolde I get Woodland rushes us to put them in before they can acclimate to the house. What a run around and hassle you do not want to deal with.

text: I’d like to share my experiences of working with Dawn Calvert at V&W for the past 15 plus years. I’m a kitchen and bath designer. name: Kevin Cosma
text:
If you're a big company and want to do business with V & W, then you'll probably get treated right.

But, from my personal experience as an individual, they couldn't care less about you.
They did not have the part in stock, and they had no interest in trying to obtain it for me. (even though they said they order it if I couldn't get it anywhere else)

I've never been to a business that turns away a customer like this.

So, I can take a hint, I will not be back!

resp.text:
Hello Kevin,

We were very sorry to hear about your experience while visiting our business.

As a small locally owned and operated business, we work hard to be a part of the community and to be counted on.  We assure you we care very much about your plumbing needs.

Please contact me at the Birmingham location 205.324.9521, I would be happy to personally help you with the part you need.

- Lee Herritt, Owner

name: Dana Hamilton
text: Lauren Doss of V&W Supply Company was tremendously helpful to my husband and me recently when we remodeled both of our bathrooms.  V&W has a large selection of bathroom and kitchen fixtures, ranging in style from traditional to ultra-modern.  Lauren met with us and walked us through their large showroom,  demonstrating features of the various products, helping us to chose products that would fit our needs and budget.  After we had made our selections, she coordinated the delivery with our contractor, and the delivery arrived perfectly on schedule.  All of the products are high quality at an affordable price.  We highly recommend V&W Supply Company for bathroom and kitchen fixtures and plumbing needs.

resp.text: Dana thank you so much! We would love for you to post photos of your remodel! Call us if you need anything.

name: Bridget Smith
text: I stopped by to see a Kohler faucet in person, I was told I needed an appointment. The faucet I came to look at was literally 15 feet from me, the front desk guy chuckled when I asked if I could just look at that one faucet and be on my way, he shook his head while exaggerating a nooooooo. I would have called back and placed the order with their sales person but went a mile down the road to Southern Pipe & Supply and purchased the faucet. Work on your customer service.

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Smith,

First off we are sorry you experienced frustration while visiting our showroom.

Since March 25, 2020 for the safety of our customers and our employees we have enforced a strict policy regarding the National Pandemic we are experiencing.

Our policy states our showroom is open by appointment only and there are exactly 3 signage points before entering our showroom to explain this policy.

In reading our previous reviews you will see we provide not only a high quality product, but a fantastic customer experience.

We would like to encourage and invite you to make an appointment so you can experience this service for yourself.

Thank you for visiting our store.

name: Romina Foster
text: Awful customer service. First of all, it took them forever to get the shipment for our order. When the plumber came to install everything there was a piece missing. I called about it on Friday and said they would call me back. They never did, so I had to call again on Monday. The lady who sold us the items (Dawn) was very curt, saying that she had put that piece in the box herself and she could order another one, but she would have to charge me for it. I did not appreciate the way she talked to me or the way she handled the situation. She made it sound like I was lying about the missing piece. I told her to not order another one, that I found it on amazon and would get it from there. Thank you very much (not). Never ordering from there again, especially from Dawn!

resp.text:
Ms. Foster, we were sorry to hear of your disappointment. As you can see from our many great reviews, customer satisfaction is one of our primary goals.

When you left your first message on Friday our customer service representative was off that day. She did return your call first thing Monday morning and when you told her that the escutcheon was missing from the order she did check and didn’t find that anything was left behind.

Dawn was very apologetic if she sounded curt with you and she did mention she called and left a message to apologize.

Dawn managed to find a replacement piece for you and your mother-in-law came and picked it up yesterday.

Once again we are sorry for the frustration, the miscommunication, and inconvenience this may have caused you.

Please do not hesitate to give us a call if there is anything else we can do for you (205) 324-9521.

text:
Bought a replacement kitchen faucet here 5 years ago for nearly $500.00. After 3 years of use we began having problems with it. After another recent problem I decided to call V&W today about it. I spoke to a salesman ( Buck ? ) and asked if a faucet should last longer than that. His reply “ I don’t know. What do you want me to do about it ?”. I asked if these things usually have warranties or what. He was so rude and unhelpful. He did tell me the model number of my faucet so I could call the manufacturer- I asked if he could email it to me. He said “ no”. Well he didn’t ask me if I’d be buying any of my plumbing supplies there when we build our new home next year- because that answer would have been “ no “.
He finally just said “ call delta. Their number is 1-800- DELTA. Ha. He made it up. It’s not even enough characters. Won’t use anyplace that doesn’t help me politely with something I’ve bought there. The end.
